message: Productivity part 2 in which we will talk about devices and hardware ... Please share with us some or more of your hardware productivity acceleration secrets

data.message: اعتقد احسن جهاز هيبقى شغال كويس اللي هيكون مش عليه جوجل كروم :D
I use this SSD which makes my device 10x++ faster
There's no secrets, you get out what you put in. +1 for the SSD though.

I want to share also what u can do with a device with pen (pressure sensitive) you can just replace papers take notes ... Solve math problems ... Draw ... With alot of software which help u really do awesome productivity job .... I have this old but gold 2012 note 10.1 which I may replace it if possible with surface pro one ... if u are a student this choice is badly fiting you
ما تفسمش الهارد بارتيشنز كتير. كفاية اتنين بس في حالة الويندوز والسي ما يقلش عن 50 جيجا

Microsoft arc surface with touch scroll 
رحمتني من التاتش بتاع اللاب وبرده من المواسات اللي كل شويه البكره تبوظ فوق كل ده كمان بلوتوث مش محتاجه قطعه تانيه علشان تتصل بجهازك

I use Logitech G602 wireless gaming mouse. It has 11 programmable controls and different profiles for each app. Since I use Eclipse everyday for Java development, I assigned some of the keys to perform the following keystrokes:
1) Copy
2) Paste
3) ctrl + / -- to comment code
4) ctrl + shift + Num+ -- to collapse code
5) ctrl + shift + f -- format code
6) Alt+Left Arrow -- back to previous code
7) Delete
8) Enter
I also have Logitech G510s mechanical backlit keyboard and use it for the same purposes. It has 18 programmable keys + a small display + headphone input + microphone input + volume wheel

To replace the normal H.D.D with SSD one I have bought a 10$ HDD Caddy and replaced my DVD WR with the original HDD and make the SSD for windows, it's faster at least by 10X, Wireless keyboard and mouse and LED 40 inch and connecting my laptop with it through HDMI cable, working even while sleeping on the sofa.
Core i7 + 16 GB RAM + 256 GB ADATA SSD FOR OS + 1 TB for VMs ext4 file system+ Fedora OS

I don't understand why people split their HDD honestly ... It doesn't affect recovery, you don't lose anything when you don't, it is just a waste. Huge waste. 50GB isn't enough for Windows now with all the applications we are using. And one of your drives will always be full and you start adding stuff to the other in different places.
I would like to point out that I have been using ONE partition since Windows 95 and I NEVER ran into troubles; I do know what I am talking about
I think SSDs are the biggest favor you could do yourself, both as a developer and a normal user. It's the best investment you could make with your money.
